snippet: The Federal Reserve said that Hurricane Sandy, which hit the East Coast at the end of October, cut output by nearly one percentage point.
abstract: Federal Reserve reports that industrial production fell unexpectedly by 0.4 percent in October due to Hurricane Sandy, but factory growth appears steady.
lead_paragraph: The Federal Reserve said that Hurricane Sandy, which hit the East Coast at the end of October, cut output by nearly one percentage point.

headline.seo: Industrial Production in U.S. Falls After Storm’s Disruption
headline.main: Industrial Production in U.S. Falls After Storm’s Disruption
headline.print_headline: Industrial Production in U.S. Falls After Storm’s Disruption
